lead_paragraph: Frank Gansz, the former Kansas City Chiefs coach, who had been out of football since 2001, was hired to coach special teams at Southern Methodist. Under Gansz, who turns 70 in November, the Chiefs were 4-11 in the strike year of 1987 and 4-11-1 in 1988.
